measured_by: scrounging rate (conditional probability of joining an observed patch)
justification: "We next computed scrounging rates as conditional probabilities for players to join a patch where they had observed one (or more) exploiting group member(s)."

topic_or_construct: Propensity to switch to social relocation
measured_by: baseline switching probability from the Social Hidden Markov Decision Model
justification: "Our model simultaneously infers the time-dependent transition probabilities between latent states … The top row shows baseline switching probabilities across all situations in which participants observe (a) successful player(s)."

topic_or_construct: Selectivity based on distance to others
measured_by: decision weight for visible patch distance (β_D) in the Social Hidden Markov Decision Model
justification: "We estimated the condition-specific influence of … visible patch distance D … Participants were more likely to use social information if observed successful group members were close rather than farther away."

topic_or_construct: Selectivity based on number of co-exploiters
measured_by: decision weight for number of visible exploiting players (β_N) in the Social Hidden Markov Decision Model
justification: "We estimated … the number of visible exploiting players N … participants preferentially decided to join patches where fewer group members were exploiting."

measured_by: average number of coins collected per group / proportion of players exploiting a patch
justification: "Collective performance was higher if, on average, fewer players exploited a patch (Fig. 2d, bottom)," indicating that group success was quantified by coins collected or current exploitation proportion.

measured_by: number of coins collected per participant
justification: "Participants incentivized on the group level showed no difference in performance between environments … (Fig. 2a)," where performance was plotted as coins collected per individual.
